intro: Alangium villosum subsp. parviflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered alangium, is a shrub native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces red berries that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by animals. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
